瓍字的基本解释

瓍
suí
随侯之珠的简称。传说中国古代隋地有个诸侯随（又写作“隋”）侯，发现一条大蛇受了伤，他用药给它治好伤后，大蛇从江中衔了一颗宝珠来报答他，这颗宝珠就叫“随珠”，又简称为“随”，又写作“瓍”。

瓍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［suí］
［《集韻》句為切，平支，邪。］
珠名。

瓍字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　瓍； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页745第09
【集韻】旬爲切，音隨。珠也。蛇銜之以報隨侯，楚辭因从玉。

瓍字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
瓍字的起名意思

暂无。

瓍
Basic explanation of words
瓍
suí
Abbreviation for Sui Hou Zhizhu. Legend has it that there was a prince Sui (also written as "Sui") in the Sui area in ancient China. He found that a big snake was injured. After he cured it with medicine, the big snake took a treasure from the river to repay him. This treasure was called "Suizhu", also referred to as "Sui", is also written as "瓍".
瓍
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［suí］
[The sentence in "Jiyun" is cut, flat, and evil. ]
Bead name.
瓍
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Jade Character Department] 　瓍; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 745 09
[Ji Yun] Xian is cut, and the sound follows. Bead also. The title of the snake is retribution to the prince, and the poems of Chu are from jade.
